intro: Tribulus megistopterus, commonly known as the large calyx tribulus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Zygophyllaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and spiny stems. The plant produces small, red berries that contain several seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
